seriesJson.title: Sexuality: a search for perspective
seriesJson.description: A series of lectures from an interdisciplinary colloquy on human sexuality, held on the campus of Michigan State University.

node.title: #10 The Emancipation of Women and the Sexual Revolution -- Sidney Cornelia Callahan, author and Lecturer from NYC.
Culture, class, and color: A minority view
node.description: The eleventh program in this series presents a lecture from  Dr. Charles R. Lawrence, Chairman of the Department of Sociology at Brooklyn College of the City, University of New York.

node.title: Marital and sexual health in a modern society
node.description: The twelfth program of this series presents a lecture by Dr. Clark E. Vincent, Director of the Behavioral Science Center at the Bowman Gray School of Medicine at Wake Forrest University. Vincent urges greater sexual education for young people. He also talks about aspects of healthy marriages.

node.title: #5 The Other American Dilemma: Sexual Apartheid-Women -- Violette S. Lindbeck, Assistant Professor of Philosophy at Souther Connecticut State College.
Premarital sex codes: The old and the new
node.description: The ninth program of this series presents a lecture by Dr. Ira L. Reiss, Professor of Sociology at the University of Minnesota.

node.title: #1 Dr. James Leslie McCary - "Why Sex Education?"
Anthropological perspectives of sexuality
node.description: This third program in the series features a lecture by Weston La Barre, Professor of Anthropology at Duke University.

node.title: #4 Is a New Sexuality Possible? Reflections on Modernism in the Arts and Religion -- Dr. Tom F. Driver, Professor of Theology and Literature at the Union Theological Seminary, New York.
Who owns fertility?
node.description: The eighth program in this series presents a lecture from Dr. Alan F. Guttmacher, M.D. President of the Planned Parenthood World Population Organization in New York.

node.title: The protection of the person in laws regarding sexual behavior
node.description: The sixth program in this series features John T. Noonan, professor at the School of Law at the University of California, Berkley.

node.title: #7 Are Sex Laws Necessary? -- Ralph Slovenko, Attorney at Law, New Orleans.
Sex and the soul
node.description: The thirteenth program in this series features a lecture from Dr. Otis A. Maxfield, Director of training for the American Foundation of Religion and Psychiatry, New York.
